column4: I am sharing internet (via firestarter)   to my desktop as for some  reason it can't connect to my router (too far away)
however, my laptop can.. problem is.. I'm afraid I'm going to kill my LCD in my laptop having it on all the time
but if I shut the lid.. bam. Internet disconnects
from the laptop I mean.. therefore.. no connection to even share
pisses me off because I went to power management and set everything accordingly
sorry... im just crazy tired and I wanted to fix this.. it's been driving me crazy. All I have happen when laptop lid is closed.. at all.. is  to turn off the monitor
presario c500
does it go in standby when you close the lid?
so you are sure it's not going into standby?
the only thing I can think up of right now is that some script is getting executed when closing the lid, There's a whole bunch somewhere in /etc
an ACPI event might actually be firing
just wondering what happens when you do /etc/init.d/acpid stop and then close the lid?
you're still here yes

and to answer your other question, I think it might actually be possible for some ACPI things to behave differently depending on the model. And maybe it's even possible for there to be some firmware somewhere doing something.
so wait, the problem still occurs?
probably because for IRC you have to time out, some packets get lost but oh well.
I'm wondering if this is an issue with Firestarter (or actually what it uses to share the connection)
so wait, you close the lid and wifi disconnects?
this just sounds way too weird
ok well, silly suggestion, but can't you just turn the LCD display off?
it doesn't do it on mine, X61t
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+bug/359199 -- the only bug report I could find
I'm not sure if drawing black matters all that much :-) But I honestly don't know
I'm going to work on some other things, but good luck :-)
